title: 'US ready to turn page on politics of division, hate': Harris takes jibe at Trump, says 'baton is in our hands'
content: At the Congressional Black Caucus’s Phoenix Awards dinner, Vice President Kamala Harris contrasted her administration's agenda with former President Trump's, focusing on healthcare and economic opportunity. President Joe Biden emphasized his commitment to unity and rebuilding the middle class while condemning divisive actions like the January 6 insurrection and attacks on affirmative action.
summary: At the Congressional Black Caucus’s Phoenix Awards dinner, Vice President Kamala Harris contrasted her administration's agenda with former President Trump's, focusing on healthcare and economic opportunity. President Joe Biden emphasized his commitment to unity and rebuilding the middle class while condemning divisive actions like the January 6 insurrection and attacks on affirmative action.

title: Imran Khan comprares Pakistan's ruling dispensation with Yahya Khan's era, says 'no point' in calling Shehbaz Sharif PM
content: Imran Khan, the imprisoned former prime minister of Pakistan, has drawn parallels between the current political environment and the era of military ruler Yahya Khan. He criticized the ruling coalition and institutions for corruption and lack of rule of law. Khan also highlighted poor economic conditions and urged for more foreign investment in Pakistan.
summary: Imran Khan, the imprisoned former prime minister of Pakistan, has drawn parallels between the current political environment and the era of military ruler Yahya Khan. He criticized the ruling coalition and institutions for corruption and lack of rule of law. Khan also highlighted poor economic conditions and urged for more foreign investment in Pakistan.

title: Massachusetts state police recruit dies during boxing training exercise
content: Enrique Delgado-Garcia, a 25-year-old Massachusetts state police recruit, died after becoming unresponsive during a defensive tactics exercise at the academy. Despite quick medical intervention and hospitalization, he did not survive. An investigation is ongoing, and Delgado-Garcia will receive full state police honors for his service.
summary: Enrique Delgado-Garcia, a 25-year-old Massachusetts state police recruit, died after becoming unresponsive during a defensive tactics exercise at the academy. Despite quick medical intervention and hospitalization, he did not survive. An investigation is ongoing, and Delgado-Garcia will receive full state police honors for his service.

title: Won't give California wildfire aid if governor doesn’t change water policy: Donald Trump
content: Donald Trump has threatened to withhold federal aid for battling California wildfires unless Governor Gavin Newsom changes a policy that protects the endangered smelt fish. Trump criticized Newsom and promised ample water for farmers if reelected, while also linking various state issues to Vice President Kamala Harris's previous roles in California.
summary: Donald Trump has threatened to withhold federal aid for battling California wildfires unless Governor Gavin Newsom changes a policy that protects the endangered smelt fish. Trump criticized Newsom and promised ample water for farmers if reelected, while also linking various state issues to Vice President Kamala Harris's previous roles in California.

title: Does Google’s milliseconds ad constitute an illegal monopoly?
content: A federal court in Virginia is currently evaluating whether Google's ad tech stack constitutes an illegal monopoly. The justice department and several states claim that Google's dominance has negatively impacted publishers and advertisers. Google argues its innovations have enhanced ad quality, but the government accuses it of manipulating ad sales auctions to benefit itself.
summary: A federal court in Virginia is currently evaluating whether Google's ad tech stack constitutes an illegal monopoly. The justice department and several states claim that Google's dominance has negatively impacted publishers and advertisers. Google argues its innovations have enhanced ad quality, but the government accuses it of manipulating ad sales auctions to benefit itself.

title: Tropical Storm Ileana makes landfall on Mexico's Sinaloa coast after pounding Los Cabos
content: Tropical Storm Ileana made landfall in Sinaloa, Mexico, after hitting Los Cabos with winds of 40 mph. The storm reached near Topolobampo and is expected to weaken into a tropical depression over the Gulf of California. Authorities prepared shelters and suspended classes to ensure safety in affected areas.
summary: Tropical Storm Ileana made landfall in Sinaloa, Mexico, after hitting Los Cabos with winds of 40 mph. The storm reached near Topolobampo and is expected to weaken into a tropical depression over the Gulf of California. Authorities prepared shelters and suspended classes to ensure safety in affected areas.

title: Is North Korea's nuclear threat growing? New photos raise alarm
content: North Korea released images of its uranium enrichment facility, suggesting several undisclosed nuclear sites. The photos likely show the Kangson site with Kim Jong Un inspecting centrifuges. Analysts note possible expansions at Yongbyon and Kangson, indicating progress in North Korea's uranium enrichment efforts to enhance its nuclear arsenal.
summary: North Korea released images of its uranium enrichment facility, suggesting several undisclosed nuclear sites. The photos likely show the Kangson site with Kim Jong Un inspecting centrifuges. Analysts note possible expansions at Yongbyon and Kangson, indicating progress in North Korea's uranium enrichment efforts to enhance its nuclear arsenal.

title: 'Invasion of my privacy': Former first lady Melania Trump slams FBI’s Mar-a-Lago raid, says 'warning to all Americans'
content: Melania Trump criticized the FBI's 2022 raid on Mar-a-Lago as an invasion of privacy and a warning to all Americans about respecting freedom and rights. The raid recovered over 100 classified documents. Her upcoming memoir, set for release on October 1, will provide more details.
summary: Melania Trump criticized the FBI's 2022 raid on Mar-a-Lago as an invasion of privacy and a warning to all Americans about respecting freedom and rights. The raid recovered over 100 classified documents. Her upcoming memoir, set for release on October 1, will provide more details.

title: Egypt train collision: Two passenger trains collide; three dead, 49 injured
content: A train collision in Zagazig, northeast of Cairo, killed three people, including two children, and injured 49 others. Five of the injured are critically hurt. Rescue operations continue as emergency responders assist those affected. This incident underscores persistent challenges within Egypt's railway system despite government promises for improvements.
summary: A train collision in Zagazig, northeast of Cairo, killed three people, including two children, and injured 49 others. Five of the injured are critically hurt. Rescue operations continue as emergency responders assist those affected. This incident underscores persistent challenges within Egypt's railway system despite government promises for improvements.

title: ABC moderator Linsey Davis admits to fact-checking Trump due to concerns raised in CNN debate
content: ABC News anchor Linsey Davis faced criticism for repeatedly fact-checking Donald Trump during a recent US presidential debate while not challenging Kamala Harris. Davis explained that her decision was influenced by concerns from a previous CNN debate. Despite backlash, she defended her approach, acknowledging the difficulty in catching every incorrect statement.
summary: ABC News anchor Linsey Davis faced criticism for repeatedly fact-checking Donald Trump during a recent US presidential debate while not challenging Kamala Harris. Davis explained that her decision was influenced by concerns from a previous CNN debate. Despite backlash, she defended her approach, acknowledging the difficulty in catching every incorrect statement.

title: Typhoon Yagi claims 350 lives, 74 in Myanmar; 89 missing
content: Typhoon Yagi's impact on Myanmar has led to a death toll of 74, with nearly 350 lives lost across Southeast Asia. At least 89 people are missing. Floods and landslides have displaced approximately 240,000 people in Myanmar. In a rare move, the junta has requested international aid amid ongoing conflict since the military coup in 2021.
summary: Typhoon Yagi's impact on Myanmar has led to a death toll of 74, with nearly 350 lives lost across Southeast Asia. At least 89 people are missing. Floods and landslides have displaced approximately 240,000 people in Myanmar. In a rare move, the junta has requested international aid amid ongoing conflict since the military coup in 2021.

title: Mother sells Taylor Swift's concert tickets after singer endorses Kamala Harris, netizens react
content: Taylor Swift endorsed Kamala Harris, leading to varied reactions. A mother sold concert tickets due to Swift's political views, criticizing her non-Christian beliefs and supporting Donald Trump. The endorsement increased traffic to vote.gov, demonstrating Swift's strong influence on young voters.
summary: Taylor Swift endorsed Kamala Harris, leading to varied reactions. A mother sold concert tickets due to Swift's political views, criticizing her non-Christian beliefs and supporting Donald Trump. The endorsement increased traffic to vote.gov, demonstrating Swift's strong influence on young voters.

title: 6 foreigners arrested over alleged plan to destabilise Venezuela by attacking President Nicolas Maduro, says government
content: Venezuelan authorities have detained six individuals, including three Americans, over allegations of plotting an attack on President Nicolas Maduro. This development comes amid rising tensions with the US and Spain after a contested presidential election. Officials claim the suspects were involved in planning terrorist activities and have confiscated a large cache of weapons.
summary: Venezuelan authorities have detained six individuals, including three Americans, over allegations of plotting an attack on President Nicolas Maduro. This development comes amid rising tensions with the US and Spain after a contested presidential election. Officials claim the suspects were involved in planning terrorist activities and have confiscated a large cache of weapons.

title: Comoros president's attacker found dead in prison cell, investigation underway
content: A soldier who attacked Comoros President Azali Assoumani with a knife during a funeral was found dead in his prison cell under unclear circumstances. Authorities are investigating both the motive behind the attack and the cause of his death. The president sustained minor injuries but is out of danger.
summary: A soldier who attacked Comoros President Azali Assoumani with a knife during a funeral was found dead in his prison cell under unclear circumstances. Authorities are investigating both the motive behind the attack and the cause of his death. The president sustained minor injuries but is out of danger.

title: Salvagers launch new attempt to tow an oil tanker blown up by Yemen's Houthi rebels
content: Salvage operations have started for the Greek-flagged oil tanker Sounion, which is burning in the Red Sea after being attacked by Yemen's Houthi rebels. The EU's Operation Aspides is providing security for tugboats involved in the effort. The tanker holds 1 million barrels of crude oil, heightening concerns about an environmental disaster.
summary: Salvage operations have started for the Greek-flagged oil tanker Sounion, which is burning in the Red Sea after being attacked by Yemen's Houthi rebels. The EU's Operation Aspides is providing security for tugboats involved in the effort. The tanker holds 1 million barrels of crude oil, heightening concerns about an environmental disaster.

title: 'Disgusting': Trump campaign slams New York Times for 'blood and soil' headline to describe Vance’s ideology
content: Donald Trump and JD Vance's campaign criticized The New York Times for a headline they found "disgusting." The article accused Vance of making inflammatory comments about Haitian immigrants, which were linked to recent bomb threats. Trump's advisor and other Republicans demanded an apology from the newspaper, calling it unethical.
summary: Donald Trump and JD Vance's campaign criticized The New York Times for a headline they found "disgusting." The article accused Vance of making inflammatory comments about Haitian immigrants, which were linked to recent bomb threats. Trump's advisor and other Republicans demanded an apology from the newspaper, calling it unethical.

title: Norway's crown princess’ son arrested again for allegedly violating restraining order against ex-girlfriend
content: Marius Borg Hoiby, son of Norway’s Crown Princess Mette-Marit, was rearrested for violating a restraining order against his ex-girlfriend after initial detention in August for causing bodily harm to that woman. He now faces additional allegations of domestic abuse and threats against others. Hoiby denied all accusations, according to his lawyer.
summary: Marius Borg Hoiby, son of Norway’s Crown Princess Mette-Marit, was rearrested for violating a restraining order against his ex-girlfriend after initial detention in August for causing bodily harm to that woman. He now faces additional allegations of domestic abuse and threats against others. Hoiby denied all accusations, according to his lawyer.

title: JD Vance explains why he changed his stance for Donald Trump, Elon Musk reacts
content: "If you were to ask what caused me to change my tune about President Trump from 2016 to 2020, I could give you a few reasons. But what we're seeing in Springfield really drives it home," Ohio senator JD Vance said. Ohio's Springfield has been on the edge over the bizarre rumor that Haitians immigrants living there have been killing pet cats and dogs to eat them.
summary: "If you were to ask what caused me to change my tune about President Trump from 2016 to 2020, I could give you a few reasons. But what we're seeing in Springfield really drives it home," Ohio senator JD Vance said. Ohio's Springfield has been on the edge over the bizarre rumor that Haitians immigrants living there have been killing pet cats and dogs to eat them.

title: When Laura Loomer said she's single because she's too focused on Donald Trump
content: ​"Because Trump is more important than you. Trump is going to save our country. And so you need to understand that President Trump is more important than you. And if you think that you’re more important than President Trump, then you have some kind of, like, delusional personality disorder. I have to say that was the end of that relationship. President Trump’s my number-one priority right now," Laura said earlier explaining why she's single.
summary: ​"Because Trump is more important than you. Trump is going to save our country. And so you need to understand that President Trump is more important than you. And if you think that you’re more important than President Trump, then you have some kind of, like, delusional personality disorder. I have to say that was the end of that relationship. President Trump’s my number-one priority right now," Laura said earlier explaining why she's single.

title: New video claims Africans in Dayton were grilling cats, JD Vance says 'shame on Kamala'
content: Amid the major controversy over rumors that Haitians are eating cats and dogs in Ohio's Springfield, a new video posted by Christopher F Rufo, claimed that African migrants last year were filmed grilling cats in Dayton. And the claim found its backing from GOP's vice presidential candidate JD Vance who condemned how the story "debunked" by media turned out to have merit. "Kamala Harris and her media apparatchiks should be ashamed of themselves," Vance said sharing Christopher's post.
summary: Amid the major controversy over rumors that Haitians are eating cats and dogs in Ohio's Springfield, a new video posted by Christopher F Rufo, claimed that African migrants last year were filmed grilling cats in Dayton. And the claim found its backing from GOP's vice presidential candidate JD Vance who condemned how the story "debunked" by media turned out to have merit. "Kamala Harris and her media apparatchiks should be ashamed of themselves," Vance said sharing Christopher's post.
